intro: Lomaridium binervatum, commonly known as the two-veined lomaridium, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have two distinct veins, giving it its common name. Lomaridium binervatum is typically found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
